video_title: How to Pass Tier 1 & 2 Selections - Part 2/3: Tier 2 Selections
key_facts: Passing Tier 2 selections requires a combination of specific physical fitness (rucking, lifting heavy weights), being an excellent teammate, and possessing extreme mental resilience to never quit.
Tier 2 selections are fundamentally different from Tier 1, emphasizing team-oriented events and using negative reinforcement to break down candidates.
Being a 'gray man'—a reliable, helpful, and low-profile teammate—is crucial, as candidates can be removed based on peer evaluations.
Mental fortitude, including mastering positive self-talk and having a strong personal 'why,' is essential for enduring the designed misery of the selection process.
Endurance running alone is insufficient; the ability to carry heavy loads (rucking) over distance is a great equalizer and a critical skill.
